interlinear-text.item: Giljanskij jazyk by Rastorgueva et al

phrase.item: Hello!
Hello!
How are you? (lit. How is your condition?)
Fine. (lit. My condition is good.)
What are you doing? How are you getting on?
I am not bad.
What are your children doing?
Praise God, they are not bad. They are studying and working.
Where are you going?
A new store has opened near your house. I am going there.
What sort of store is it? (lit. This store, what store is it?)
I have not seen it. They say: "It is a good store. It has everything."
I want to go there and buy something for the children.
It is a pity that I cannot come. I have a bit of work [to do], otherwise I would come with you.
Can you tell me what my mother is doing?
Do you not know that my mother is ill?
No, God forbid.
What has happened to her?
Yes, it is now two months that she is unwell.
Dear sister, forgive me!
I did not know, otherwise I should have come a thousand times.
May God keep you for us.
I will always say, "My dear Zahra is very kind."
Goodbye.
